label: 侘茶
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: A style of tea ceremony stressing an elegant, quiet mood bordering on sadness. This style, which was particularly popular during the last quarter of the sixteenth century, was brought to perfection by Sen no Rikyu (1522-1599).［千利休］
